summary: Patients receiving care from Medicare- and Medicaid-certified hospice care providers could be better protected from abuse and neglect. These providers aren't required to report abuse and neglect allegations if the perpetrator is unaffiliated with the hospice, such as a caregiver or family member. This makes it difficult for the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services to ensure that providers protect patients. We recommended that CMS...
title: Abuse and Neglect: CMS Should Strengthen Reporting Requirements to Better Protect Individuals Receiving Hospice Care
